status.text: First reading, referred to Local Government.

original.text:
H-0210.1
HOUSE BILL 1029
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentatives Shavers, Reed, Peterson, and Wylie
Prefiled 12/10/24.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Local Government.
AN ACT Relating to 3D-printed building construction; and adding a new section to chapter 19.27 RCW.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 1. A new section is added to chapter 19.27 RCW to read as follows:
(1) Within the adoption cycle for the 2024 Washington state residential code, the state building code council shall amend the Washington state residential code to adopt the 2024 international residential code appendix BM related to 3D-printed building construction.
(2) Within the adoption cycle for the 2027 Washington state residential code, the state building code council shall amend the Washington state residential code to authorize 3D-printed building construction in the main body of the code rather than in an appendix.
--- END ---

summary.text:
Purpose

The purpose of House Bill 1029 is to provide a framework for the regulation and adoption of 3D-printed building construction within the state's building codes. The bill mandates updates to the Washington state residential code to include specific provisions for 3D-printed construction, which currently does not have formal recognition in the main body of the code. This aims to modernize building practices and enhance the acceptance of innovative construction technologies.

Key Provisions

Amendments to the Washington State Residential Code

  • The state building code council is required to:
    • Amend the 2024 Washington state residential code to include the 2024 international residential code appendix BM, which pertains to 3D-printed building construction.
    • Authorize 3D-printed building construction in the main body of the Washington state residential code during the adoption cycle for the 2027 residential code, moving it from the appendix into the core regulations.

keywords.text: 3d-printed construction building codes residential code council amendments technology adoption
